lexUnit.name: plead.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: enter a plea, usually "innocent' or "guilty".

sentence.text: He had decided , as advised , to plead guilty and proceedings had moved with dizzying speed .
Defendants were frequently prepared to plead guilty under the old law with its maximum penalty of two years ' imprisonment .
If I plead guilty to that , I thought , I 'll end up in the nick for the rest of my life .
They also plead not guilty to the murder of Special Constable Glenn Goodman and the attempted murder of PC Alexander Kelly , 33 , in another shooting incident earlier that morning .
Through a curious loophole in the present law Hart was able to plead guilty to motoring offences that can be dealt with in a magistrates court -- and was jailed for only four months .
Defendants who plead not guilty to rape , generally do so on the ground that the victim consented .
Drug charge : English teacher Sandra Gregory , 27 , from Halifax , West Yorkshire , charged with heroin smuggling in Thailand , said she would plead guilty .
Such an arrangement would encourage defendants to plead guilty to the lesser offence and thus spare the complainant the trauma of giving evidence in court .
He made it clear that he would plead guilty to indecent assault but not to rape or attempted rape and he was allowed to do so . "
Alberts was expected to plead guilty to starting a fire at the Schiller University in Waterloo , south London , where he was studying hotel management .
Under arrest on suspicion since October 1990 , the two , both of whom held the rank of general under Communist rule , did not plead guilty when indicted in the Warsaw provincial court on Feb. 11 .
When the council sought to evict him for non-payment of the extra rent he pleaded in defence that the resolution was invalid .
